code: @Manual{,   title = {s3lm: Custom Implementation of Linear Regression using S3},   author = {James Balamuta},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://rd.thecoatlessprofessor.com/r-s3-lm/}, }

title: Custom Implementation of Linear Regression using S3
text: s3lm R package provides example creating custom S3 objects showing linear regression implemented.

title: Custom Implementation of Linear Regression using S3
text: install s3lm package, use: access contents, load R :

title: Custom Implementation of Linear Regression using S3
Custom Implementation of Linear Regression using S3
Custom Linear Regression Estimation — my_lm
text: Provides custom implementation R's stats::lm() linear regression function uses S3 system.

title: Custom Linear Regression Estimation — my_lm
code: my_lm(x, ...)  # Default S3 method my_lm(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'formula' my_lm(formula, data = list(), ...)  # S3 method for class 'matrix' my_lm(x, y, ...)

title: Custom Linear Regression Estimation — my_lm
text: x Either design matrix dimensions \(n \times p\) formula data parameter specified ... used. formula object class formula() provides symbolic description model fitted. data optional data frame, list environment. y vector responses dimensions \(n \times 1\).

title: Custom Linear Regression Estimation — my_lm
text: object class my_lm contains: coefficients: Estimated parameter values \(\hat{\beta}\) dimensions \(p \times 1\) cov_mat: Covariance matrix estimated parameter values dimensions \(p \times p\). sigma: Standard deviation residuals df: Degrees Freedom given \(df = N - p\) fitted.values: Fitted Values given \(\hat{y} = X\hat{\beta}\) residuals: Residuals given \(e = y - \hat{y}\) call: Information my_lm() function called.

title: Custom Linear Regression Estimation — my_lm
text: Given response vector \(y\) dimensions \(n \times 1\), design matrix \(X\) dimensions \(n \times p\), vector parameters \(\beta\) dimensions \(p \times 1\), error vector \(\epsilon\) dimensions \(n \times 1\) \(\epsilon \sim N\left( {0,{\sigma ^2}} \right)\), standard linear regression model can stated : $$y  = {X'}\beta + \epsilon$$ least ordinary squares (OLS) solutions : $$\hat \beta  = {\left( {{X'}X} \right)^{ - 1}}{X'}y$$ $$cov\left( {\hat \beta } \right) = {\sigma ^2}{\left( {{X^T}X} \right)^{ - 1}}$$

title: Custom Linear Regression Estimation — my_lm
code: ## Matrix interface  # Create a design matrix x = cbind(1, mtcars$disp)  # Extract response y = mtcars$mpg  # Calculate outcome my_model = my_lm(x, y)  ## Formula interface  # Calculate  my_model = my_lm(mpg ~ disp, data = mtcars)

what: Print Model Information for Custom Linear Regression — print.my_lm
title: Print Model Information for Custom Linear Regression — print.my_lm
text: Provides improved output displaying fitted model using custom my_lm() function.

title: Print Model Information for Custom Linear Regression — print.my_lm
Print Model Information for Custom Linear Regression — print.my_lm
Print Model Information for Custom Linear Regression — print.my_lm
code: model = my_lm(mpg ~ disp, data = mtcars)  # Explicit call of the print function print(model) #> Call: #> my_lm.formula(formula = mpg ~ disp, data = mtcars) #>  #> Coefficients: #> (Intercept)        disp  #> 29.59985476 -0.04121512   # Implicit call of the print function model #> Call: #> my_lm.formula(formula = mpg ~ disp, data = mtcars) #>  #> Coefficients: #> (Intercept)        disp  #> 29.59985476 -0.04121512

what: Compute Inference for Custom Linear Regression — summary.my_lm
title: Compute Inference for Custom Linear Regression — summary.my_lm
text: Calculates standard error, t-test values, p-values parameter estimate.

title: Compute Inference for Custom Linear Regression — summary.my_lm
code: # S3 method for class 'my_lm' summary(object, ...)  # S3 method for class 'summary.my_lm' print(x, ...)

title: Compute Inference for Custom Linear Regression — summary.my_lm
text: object object class my_lm. ... Additional options. x object class summary.my_lm.

title: Compute Inference for Custom Linear Regression — summary.my_lm
text: object class summary.my_lm contains: est_mat: matrix following named columns... Estimate: parameter (beta) estimated values Std. Err: standard error values parameter estimates. t value: t-test value parameter estimate. Pr(>|t|): p-value t-test value parameter. call: Information my_lm() function called.

title: Compute Inference for Custom Linear Regression — summary.my_lm
code: # Compute the model model = my_lm(mpg ~ disp, data = mtcars)  # Calculate the inference values model_inference = summary(model)  # Display inference values model_inference #> Call: #> my_lm.formula(formula = mpg ~ disp, data = mtcars) #>  #>               Estimate   Std. Err t value  Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept) 29.5998548  1.2297195 24.0704 < 2.2e-16 *** #> disp        -0.0412151  0.0047118 -8.7472  9.38e-10 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1
